sequence.name: My_Windows 7 (Horizon Cloud)
sequence.description: Default optimization template for Windows 7 (Horizon Air Hybrid)

changeLog.log: Template update: Add item "VMware Horizon DaaS Agent Desktop Manager Address" to show Desktop Manager Address for DaaS Agent
Template update: Add group "Validate Horizon Cloud Configuration" to only check some configuration for Horizon Cloud

Template update: Add items "Disable Hardware Acceleration (GPU Rendering) for Microsoft Internet Explorer", "Disable Hardware Acceleration (GPU Rendering) for Microsoft Office 2010" "Disable Hardware Acceleration (GPU Rendering) for Microsoft Office 2016/2013" to disable hardware acceleration if there's no hardware GPU.

step.name: Disk count
step.description: Only one hard drive installed

step.name: Disk space
step.description: 30GB size (can be increased later but not decreasedï¼‰

step.name: Desktop Windows Manager Session Manager Sevice
step.description: Show Desktop Windows Manager Session Manager Sevice start mode and state

step.name: VMware DaaS Agent Service
step.description: Show VMware Daas Agent Sevice start mode and state

step.name: VMware Blast Service
step.description: Show VMware Blast Service start mode and state

step.name: VMware Horizon View Agent Service
step.description: Show VMware Horizon View Agent Sevice start mode and state

step.name: Windows Firewall Service
step.description: Show Windows Firewall Service start mode and state

step.name: VMware Horizon DaaS Agent
step.description: Show VMware Horizon DaaS Agent version

step.name: VMware Horizon DaaS Agent Desktop Manager Address
step.description: Show VMware Horizon DaaS Agent Desktop Manager Address from Registry

step.name: VMware Horizon DaaS Health Agent
step.description: Show Horizon DaaS Health Agent version

step.name: VMware Horizon Agent
step.description: Show VMware Horizon Agent version

step.name: VMware Tools
step.description: Show VMware Tools version

step.name: VMware User Environment Manager
step.description: Show VMware User Environment Manager version

group.name: Modifications to Standard Image
group.description: Select "Disable" in the Options tab of any Task to bypass processing. Disable this entire section in the same manner.

step.name: Load HKCU for editing
step.description: Open HKey Users (Default User Profile) for Editing

step.name: Default Screen Saver
step.description: Set the default screen saver to "Blank" - any graphics screensaver will put extra load on the virtual infrastructure.

step.name: Disable Hardware Acceleration (GPU Rendering) for Microsoft Internet Explorer
step.description: Disable Hardware Acceleration (GPU Rendering) for Microsoft Internet Explorer if there's no hardware GPU

condition.query: SELECT Name FROM Win32_DisplayControllerConfiguration WHERE Not Name = 'VMware SVGA 3D'

step.name: Disable Hardware Acceleration (GPU Rendering) for Microsoft Office 2010
step.description: Disable Hardware Acceleration (GPU Rendering) for Microsoft Office 2010 if there's no hardware GPU

condition.query: SELECT Name FROM Win32_DisplayControllerConfiguration WHERE Not Name = 'VMware SVGA 3D'

step.name: Disable Hardware Acceleration (GPU Rendering) for Microsoft Office 2016/2013
step.description: Disable Hardware Acceleration (GPU Rendering) for Microsoft Office 2016/2013 if there's no hardware GPU

condition.query: SELECT Name FROM Win32_DisplayControllerConfiguration WHERE Not Name = 'VMware SVGA 3D'

step.name: Screen Saver
step.description: Set the Screen Saver to None

step.name: Set Default Wallpaper
step.description: Set wallpaper to a "non existing" file to disable the end users ability to set a wallpaper.

step.name: Visual Effects - Adjust for best performance
step.description: Set Windows Visual Effects to Optimized for best performance.

step.name: Visual Effects - Animate windows when minimizing and maxmizing
step.description: Disable Animate windows when minimizing and maxmizing Visual Effect

step.name: Visual Effects - Animations in the taskbar
step.description: Disable Animations in the taskbar Visual Effect

step.name: Visual Effects - Enable Peek
step.description: Disable Enable Peek Visual Effect

step.name: Visual Effects - Play animations in windows
step.description: Turn off Play animations in windows.

step.name: Visual Effects - Save taskbar thumbnail previews
step.description: Disable Save taskbar thumbnail previews Visual Effect

step.name: Visual Effects - Show translucent selection rectangle
step.description: Disable Show translucent selection rectangle Visual Effect

step.name: Visual Effects - Show window contents while dragging
step.description: Disable Show window contents while dragging Visual Effect

step.name: Visual Effects - Smooth edges of screen fonts
step.description: Disable Smooth edges of screen fonts Visual Effect

step.name: Visual Effects - Use drop shadows for icon labels on the desktop
step.description: Disable Use drop shadows for icon labels on the desktop Visual Effect

step.name: Unload HKCU for editing
step.description: Very Important Step! Need to close the ntuser.dat file to save changes.

step.name: Action Center Icon - Disable
step.description: The Action Center Icon notifies the user of the firewall, anti virus, security related things, etc. that may be configured differently than expected. Disabling this service can be useful to avoid end user confusion.

step.name: Customer Experience Improvement Program
step.description: Turn off the Windows Customer Experience Improvement Program

step.name: Disk Timeout Value
step.description: How long the OS will wait for a disk write or read to take place on the SAN without throwing an error

step.name: Superfetch (Registry) - Disable
step.description: Set Superfetch to boot files only.

step.name: System Restore - Disable
step.description: Disable System Restore. System Restore provides rollback capability that should not be leveraged in a VDI environment. Space and reliability are factors.

step.name: Windows Update - Disable
step.description: Disable Automatic Update - important for non persistent VMs

group.name: Apply Visual Effect Settings To Current User
group.description: Setting visual effects for current user

step.name: Adjust for best performance
step.description: Set Windows Visual Effects to Optimized for best performance.

step.name: Animate windows when minimizing and maxmizing
step.description: Disable Animate windows when minimizing and maxmizing Visual Effect

step.name: Animations in the taskbar
step.description: Disable Animations in the taskbar Visual Effect

step.name: Enable Peek
step.description: Disable Enable Peek Visual Effect

step.name: Play animations in windows
step.description: Turn off Play animations in windows.

step.name: Save taskbar thumbnail previews
step.description: Disable Save taskbar thumbnail previews Visual Effect

step.name: Show translucent selection rectangle
step.description: Disable Show translucent selection rectangle Visual Effect

step.name: Show window contents while dragging
step.description: Disable Show window contents while dragging Visual Effect

step.name: Smooth edges of screen fonts
step.description: Disable Smooth edges of screen fonts Visual Effect

step.name: Use drop shadows for icon labels on the desktop
step.description: Disable Use drop shadows for icon labels on the desktop Visual Effect

group.name: Apply Visual Effect Settings To New Users
group.description: This is a functional operation. This option must be selected so visual effect setting can be applied to new users.

step.name: Animate windows when minimizing and maxmizing
step.description: Disable Animate windows when minimizing and maxmizing Visual Effect

step.name: Animations in the taskbar
step.description: Disable Animations in the taskbar Visual Effect

step.name: Enable Peek
step.description: Disable Enable Peek Visual Effect

step.name: Save taskbar thumbnail previews
step.description: Disable Save taskbar thumbnail previews Visual Effect

step.name: Show translucent selection rectangle
step.description: Disable Show translucent selection rectangle Visual Effect

step.name: Show window contents while dragging
step.description: Disable Show window contents while dragging Visual Effect

step.name: Smooth edges of screen fonts
step.description: Disable Smooth edges of screen fonts Visual Effect

step.name: Use drop shadows for icon labels on the desktop
step.description: Disable Use drop shadows for icon labels on the desktop Visual Effect

step.name: Delete All Event Logs
step.description: Delete all event logs.

action.command: cmd /C for /f %i in ('wevtutil el') do wevtutil cl "%i"

step.name: Delete Restore Points for System Restore
step.description: Removes all restore points if they exist

step.name: Delete Uninstall Folders
step.description: Delete any hidden uninstall folders on C:\Windows, such as $NtUninstallKB893756$.

step.name: Disk Defragmenter
step.description: Run Disk Defragmenter to rearrange fragmented data

step.name: Hibernation for Power Config
step.description: Disable Hibernation for Power Config

step.name: Indexing Service
step.description: Indexing improves searches by cataloging files. Do not disable this feature for users who search often.

step.name: Last Access Timestamp
step.description: Disable Last Access Timestamp

step.name: Microsoft Feeds Synchronization
step.description: Disable Microsoft Feeds Synchronization

step.name: Superfetch Service
step.description: Stop Superfetch Service

step.name: System Protection
step.description: Turn off system protection on C:\.

step.name: Tablet PC Components
step.description: Uninstall Tablet PC Components, unless you need this feature.

step.name: Application Experience - AitAgent
step.description: Disable Application Experience - AitAgent

step.name: Autochk - Proxy
step.description: Disable Autochk - Proxy

step.name: Automatic Computer Maintenance
step.description: Turn off automatic computer maintenance

step.name: Registry Idle Backup Task
step.description: Disable Registry Idle Backup Task

step.name: Scheduled Disk Defragmentation
step.description: Disable Disk Defragmentation Schedule

step.name: System Restore Schedule
step.description: Disable System Restore Schedule

step.name: Windows Defender Idle Task
step.description: Disable Windows Defender Idle Task

step.name: Windows Defender Schedule
step.description: Disable Windows Defender Schedule

step.name: Background Intelligent Transfer Service
step.description: Transfers files in the background using idle network bandwidth. If the service is disabled, Windows Update and MSN Explorer cannot automatically download programs and other information.

step.name: Bitlocker Drive Encryption Service
step.description: Bitlocker service for drive encryption. Not recommended to encrypt VDI virtual machines.

step.name: Block Level Backup Engine Service
step.description: Used by Windows Backup

step.name: BranchCache
step.description: Used for caching files on server in a branch office.

step.name: Change Group Policy Client start mode to automatic
step.description: Responsible for applying settings configured by administrator for the computer and users through the Group Policy component.

step.name: Computer Browser
step.description: Used for browsing computers on the same network.

step.name: Desktop Window Manager Session Manager
step.description: Used for Aero - disable if Aero is not desired. (VMware product compatibility: Do not disable if View 5.3 package will be installed.)

step.name: Diagnostic Policy Service
step.description: Disable Diagnostic Policy Service

step.name: Diagnostic Service Host
step.description: Problem detection and troubleshooting resolution.

step.name: Diagnostic System Host
step.description: Problem detection and troubleshooting resolution.

step.name: Disk Defragmenter Service
step.description: Defrag can create unnessary overhead on a virtual machine - the scheduled defrag has been set to disable below as well as disabling this service.

step.name: Function Discovery Provider Host
step.description: The FDPHOST service hosts the Function Discovery (FD) network discovery providers. These FD providers supply network discovery services for the Simple Services Discovery Protocol (SSDP) and Web Services - Discovery (WS-D) protocol.

step.name: Function Discovery Resource Publication
step.description: Publishes his computer and resources attached to this computer so they can be discovered over the network.

step.name: HomeGroup Listener
step.description: Used for Homegroup services - N/A for VDI

step.name: HomeGroup Provider
step.description: Used for Homegroup services - N/A for VDI

step.name: Interactive Services Detection
step.description: Displays a dialog box when a service tries to send a message to the console.

step.name: IP Helper
step.description: Disable if IPv6 is not a factor in VDI

step.name: Media Center Extender
step.description: Allows Media Center Extenders to locate and connect to the computer.

step.name: Microsoft iSCSI Initiator Service
step.description: Not leveraged in a VDI

step.name: Microsoft Software Shadow Copy Provider
step.description: Leveraged by Windows Backup and System Restore.

step.name: Offline Files
step.description: Disable Offline Files

step.name: Reports and Solutions Control Panel Support
step.description: Provides support for viewing, sending and deletion of system-level problem reports for the Problem Reports and Solutions control panel.

step.name: Secure Socket Tunneling Protocol Service
step.description: VPN tunneling service. Not likely leveraged in a VDI environment.

step.name: SSDP Discovery
step.description: Disable SSDP Discovery

step.name: Superfetch
step.description: Service is leveraged to optimize loading of applications over time. In a non persistent or commodity based VDI environment this service may impact performance. Depends on use and organization.

step.name: Themes
step.description: Disable if you want to run "Classic" GUI

step.name: Universal PnP Host Service
step.description: Dependent on the SSDP Service.

step.name: Volume Shadow Copy Service
step.description: Used for System Restore and Backup Operations. (VMware product compatibility: Do not disable if Persona Management is in use.)

step.name: Windows Backup
step.description: Windows Backup service used by System Restore and Windows Backups.

step.name: Windows Defender Service
step.description: Windows Defender can be optionally disabled in a VDI environment especially for non persistent VMs where data will be purged. A scheduled task has also been marked to disable below.

step.name: Windows Error Reporting Service
step.description: Error reporting services leveraged by Applications when they crash to send reports to Microsoft. If using DER within VDI consider alternate configuration.

step.name: Windows Firewall
step.description: Recommended to customize instead of disable the firewall.

step.name: Windows Media Center Network Sharing Service
step.description: Used by Media Center

step.name: Windows Media Center Receiver Service
step.description: Media Center Service Related

step.name: Windows Media Center Scheduler Service
step.description: Media Center Service Related

step.name: Windows Search
step.description: If you do a lot of searching on a VM, do not disable this service.

step.name: Windows Update
step.description: If this is a non persistent VM, Windows Update should be handled differently via standard image maintenance practices.

step.name: WLAN AutoConfig
step.description: Wireless LAN Configuration - N/A for VDI environments.

step.name: WWAN AutoConfig
step.description: Service related to Mobile Broadband Devices

group.name: Sound Scheme
group.description: Set the Sound Scheme to No Sounds.

step.name: Asterisk Sound
step.description: Set Asterisk sound to none

step.name: Close Program Sound
step.description: Set Close Program sound to none

step.name: Critical Battery Alarm Sound
step.description: Set Critical Battery Alarm sound to none

step.name: Critical Stop Sound
step.description: Set Critical Stop sound to none

step.name: Default Beep Sound
step.description: Set Default Beep sound to none

step.name: Device Connect Sound
step.description: Set Device Connect sound to none

step.name: Device Disconnect Sound
step.description: Set Device Disconnect sound to none

step.name: Device Failed to Connect Sound
step.description: Set Device Failed to Connect sound to none

step.name: Exclamation Sound
step.description: Set Exclamation sound to none

step.name: Exit Windows Sound
step.description: Set Exit Windows sound to none

step.name: Low Battery Alarm Sound
step.description: Set Low Battery Alarm sound to none

step.name: Maximize Sound
step.description: Set Maximize sound to none

step.name: Menu Command Sound
step.description: Set Menu Command sound to none

step.name: Menu Pop-up Sound
step.description: Set Menu Pop-up sound to none

step.name: Minimize Sound
step.description: Set Minimize sound to none

step.name: New Fax Notification Sound
step.description: Set New Fax Notification sound to none

step.name: New Mail Notification Sound
step.description: Set New Mail Notification sound to none

step.name: No Sounds
step.description: Change Sound Scheme to No Sounds

step.name: Open Program Sound
step.description: Set Open Program sound to none

step.name: Print Complete Sound
step.description: Set Print Complete sound to none

step.name: Program Error Sound
step.description: Set Program Error sound to none

step.name: Question Sound
step.description: Set Question sound to none

step.name: Restore Down Sound
step.description: Set Restore Down sound to none

step.name: Restore Up Sound
step.description: Set Restore Up sound to none

step.name: Select Sound
step.description: Set Select sound to none

step.name: Show Toolbar Band Sound
step.description: Set Show Toolbar Band sound to none

step.name: System Notification Sound
step.description: Set System Notification sound to none

step.name: Windows Change Theme Sound
step.description: Set Windows Change Theme sound to none

step.name: Windows Explorer Blocked Pop-up Window Sound
step.description: Set Windows Explorer Blocked Pop-up Window sound to none

step.name: Windows Explorer Complete Navigation Sound
step.description: Set Windows Explorer Complete Navigation sound to none

step.name: Windows Explorer Fax error Sound
step.description: Set Windows Explorer Fax error sound to none

step.name: Windows Explorer Fax sent Sound
step.description: Set Windows Explorer Fax sent sound to none

step.name: Windows Explorer Feed Discovered Sound
step.description: Set Windows Explorer Feed Discovered sound to none

step.name: Windows Explorer Incoming call Sound
step.description: Set Windows Explorer Incoming call sound to none

step.name: Windows Explorer Move Menu Item Sound
step.description: Set Windows Explorer Move Menu Item sound to none

step.name: Windows Explorer Notification bar Sound
step.description: Set Windows Explorer Notification bar sound to none

step.name: Windows Explorer Search Provider Discovered Sound
step.description: Set Explorer Search Provider Discovered sound to none

step.name: Windows Explorer Start Navigation Sound
step.description: Set Windows Explorer Start Navigation sound to none

step.name: Windows Logoff Sound
step.description: Set Windows Logoff sound to none

step.name: Windows Logon Sound
step.description: Set Windows Logon sound to none

step.name: Windows Startup Sound
step.description: Disable play windows startup sound

step.name: Windows User Account Control Sound
step.description: Set Windows User Account Control sound to none
